content:
This Week in EOS

4th of June 2018

Editorial

And so...EOS has launched! On June 2th, block.one released their official EOS software version 1.0, an historic moment for the EOS project. But there's more to come before the blockchain is fully functional.

For instance, the community still needs to reach consensus on which chain will be adopted. Therefore, we should exercise patience until the network is up and running and we can use the EOS blockchain!

Meanwhile, the best thing to do is to keep learning more and evolve our skills. In my case, I've bought an online course which contained tutorials on c++ and EOS. Great stuff! But there's no need to spend money in order to learn about EOS. ThisweekinEOS is commited to find great content for the community. This week in particular was full of news and discussions of all kind which resulted in so much information that a single person cannot consume it all. So, browse this week's newsletter and pick what interests you the most!

Have a great week and see you in a week from now!

  • Calling all Devs: The EOSIO Bug Bounty Program is Live
